reviews.review:
This game is extremely addictive, fun and exhilarating. The experience is quite different between playing as survivor and killer. There are tons of different survivor and killer characters to play, perks and items to earn, and techniques to learn. There's a lot of replayability. Overall incredibly good. There are some balance issues, like not all killers are good, and some survivor perks are way too good and overused (Decisive Strike, Adrenaline, Dead Hard, etc.), but it's still so fun. 

Some people are toxic, but it's not nearly as bad as Dota or other popular games that have toxic communities.
If you want to have fun disable the Crossplay. The lag that comes with crossplay makes Console killers hit wider and further than they should. Do yourself a favor and disable Crossplay.

I try to befriend the killer and on average I have a fifty percent success rate and they'll kill my teammates but help me find the hatch or open the gate. Fun game, friendly community.

Aktuell wieder sehr viel am suchten, 2020 und immer noch mein absolutes Lieblingsspiel. 
Es sollte aber weiterhin am Balancing der Killer gearbeitet werden, Performance und kleine Bugs sind auch noch vorhanden. 
Trotzdem liebe ich Dead by Daylight!

It's a compelling game that is strangely fun. It has problems and things can feel at times unfair and poorly balanced, but it remains fun. There is a grind to unlock every gameplay option to kit out your characters, but you can get a few powerful perks and not necessarily grind every character by focusing on Meg and perhaps either David, Nea or Dwight and then using shards collected while playing to buy other perks.

Every game is engaging. Whether playing with friends online or switching every game with another friend and watching each other, it is very enjoyable. And frustrating, but that's part of the addiction!
